Uses of Class
chess.Board

  • Uses of Board in chess

    Subclasses of Board in chess
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    class 
    Bishop
    This class represents a bishop in the game of chess.
    class 
    King
    The King class represents a king chess piece on a chess board.
    class 
    Knight
    The Knight class represents a chess piece that moves in an L-shape and can jump over other pieces.
    class 
    Pawn
    The Pawn class represents a pawn chess piece on a chess board.
    class 
    Queen
    This class represents a queen in the game of chess.
    class 
    Rook
    This class represents a rook in the game of chess.

    Moves the bishop to a new position on the chess board.
    abstract Board
    Board.move(Board obj)
    This is an abstract method that should be implemented to make a move on the board.

    Bishop.isValid(Board[][] board, int initiali, int initialj, int finali, int finalj)
    Determines if the bishop's move from its initial position to its final position is a valid move on the given chess board.
    abstract boolean
    Board.isValid(Board[][] board, int initiali, int initialj, int finali, int finalj)
    This is an abstract method that should be implemented to determine if a move is valid on the board.

    static boolean
    Chess.reachHere(Board[][] board, int finali, int finalj, String color)
    This method checks if any of the key of the provided color except King can be validly moved to the provided position This is a helper function to CheckMate method.
